article.title: Internship Opportunities - Arkansas U.S. Export Assistance Center
article.summary: Learn about internship opportunities with the Arkansas U.S. Export Assistance Center.
article.content:
​​The U.S. Commercial Service in Little Rock, Arkansas offers internship opportunities throughout the year.

Interns will focus on the following types of assistance and support to Arkansas companies, under the direction of theU.S. Commercial Staff:

  • ​Identify appropriate market research and develop research databases of various industries in support of Arkansas' business export strategies

  • Review incoming business trade service requests, research request eligibility, & follow-up when appropriate with qualified Arkansas businesses

  • Assist in the organization and implementation of export outreach workshops and seminars in Arkansas

  • Assist with development and implementation ofad hocprojects to include trade shows, expos, webinars and other trade related activities

Eligibility

In order to participate in this program you must meet the following qualifications:

  • U.S. Citizen

  • Enrollment in a college or university

  • Availability fora minimum of 3 months, with optional continuation

  • Good communication and computer skills

Students of Business, International Relations, Economics, and Languages will benefit most from an internship at the U.S. Commercial Service.

Payment Information

The internship is avolunteer (non-paid) service. Federal regulations prohibit financial compensation. An official letter of recommendation will be provided upon successful completion of internship. University credit may also be available.

Apply

Interested applicants should send a cover letter and resume to the attention of James Bledsoe, International Trade Specialist, to the USEAC office via E-mail:james.bledsoe@trade.gov​.​
